text: Pedro Enrique Delgado Martin (born January 25, 1975 in Santa Cruz de Tenerife) is a track and field athlete from Spain. He has a disability: he is blind and a T11/B1 type athlete. He raced at the 1996 Summer Paralympics. He raced and finished in third in 800 meter T11 race. He raced at the 2000 Summer Paralympics. He finished second in the 4 X 400 meter T11-T13 race and finished third in the 1,500 meter T11 race. He raced at the 2004 Summer Paralympics and finished fourth in the 1,500 T11 meter race. == References == Category:Spanish middle-distance runners Category:Living people Category:1975 births Category:Paralympic silver medalists for Spain Category:Paralympic bronze medalists for Spain Category:1996 Summer Paralympics Category:2000 Summer Paralympics Category:2004 Summer Paralympics Category:Sportspeople with disabilities, type T11 Category:Sportspeople with disabilities, type B1 Category:People from the Canary Islands
title: Pedro Enrique Delgado Martin
